page.title: 01BLINKBONNY AND LONGYESTER
page.content: The hill foots on the Lammermuirs slope from south to north of this block. The hills are heather covered with a very impressive hill fort, its ramparts easily identified. The valleys are covered with gorse. Blinkbonny Wood is a coniferous woodland on a north facing slope and dominates the area. Sheep graze on the higher land but the major use is arable farming. The farms are seperated by woodland shelter belts. Longyester has its original stone-built steading but a recent addition is the massive circular grain dryer towering over the old farm buildings. The primary school at the road junction to the east of Longyester now lies derelict and the children now travel to Gifford. The only bus to serve the area is a private post bus.
